subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: Unicode proposal again.
msgSnippet: ... For instance, dictionary entries with thalassa sea in both Greek and Coptic side-by-side. -- Michael Everson * http://www.evertype.com
messageBody:
At 02:24 -0400 2007-05-29, John Cowan wrote:

>Coptic and Greek were disunified because there were substantial
>documents that contained both, each with its characteristic style.

For instance, dictionary entries with thalassa 'sea' in both Greek
and Coptic side-by-side.
--
Michael Everson * http://www.evertype.com
